content: basic double seed stitch scarf make time approx 12 hours yarn 150 grams worsted weight yarn needles worked flat on size 9 us knitting needles skills required knit purl cast on bind off finished size 8 wide x 58 long this scarf is a great beginner project the double seed stitch pattern ends up looking intricate and has a wonderful texture but doesn t require any advanced techniques abbreviations co cast on sts stitches k knit purl purl gauge it is not necessary to make a swatch for this pattern since it is not a fitted garment if you prefer to swatch knit 20 sts x 20 sts this should measure approx 4 x 4 cast on 40 stitches scarf will measure 8 across add stitches if you want a wider scarf row 1 k p 2 2 repeat row 1 9 more times 10 row total row 2 k p 1 1 row 3 k p 1 1 row 4 p k 1 1 row 5 p k 1 1 repeat row 2-5 until scarf reaches 58 long or desired length i recommend working the scarf until you can hold it in you hands with your arms fully outstretched to make sure it is the best length for you row 6 k p 2 2 repeat row 6 9 more times 10 row total bind off using your preferred method blocking i recommend blocking this scarf because the ends will probably shrink inwards if you are a beginner or just don t enjoy blocking it is perfectly fine to only block the ends to correct this if you do not have a blocking mat you can use an upside-down cardboard box with a towel draped over it
